content: you actual marks on paper to physically count to make sure things are working out i work better old school so i print out the morse code letters then draw everything out i typically use worsted 4 weight yarn and i would repeat the motif twice to get a good length- to test if this is appropriate for you take your yarn your recommended hook and chain 100 stitches check the length to see how long it is- can you comfortably double your motif with an extra 100 stitches is it better for you to add let s say 25 or any other number on either end for an added 50 or your chosen number doubled instead you make the best judgement call *for you* it s usually recommended that scarves are your arm span or at least as tall as you are- but it s really all personal keep in mind that really wide scarves will eat up some of that length when you wrap it around your neck so go longer than you think for *this* example we ll say that you re repeating your motif twice with no change to the 3 single_crochet at the start and 4 single_crochet at the end - this means that you will chain 200 stitches i know that s a lot- i m so sorry plus 2 if you re doing a row of double_crochet to start double_crochet in the 3rd chain from hook plus one if you re starting with a single_crochet row single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook if you d like a half_double_crochet choose either plus one or two based on personal gauge i typically do a double_crochet row so the scarf drapes nicer so you have your motif and you have your foundation chain- let s talk width the easiest way is to do a single row in the morse code motif like the pink and black scarf- please note this does *not* say i love you … i was much angrier when i made this one so if yours doesn t match up visually that s expected and work your width around it you do not need to worry about right sides/wrong sides with this version- you can just build up almost half your width insert your morse code motif and make the identical number of row on the other side copyright chae aitchison cute creepy crochet 2024 p age | 9 the black and pink version is 3 row of black double_crochet colour change one row of pink double_crochet morse code motif row another row of double_crochet in pink change colour back to black and 3 row of black double_crochet this is 8 row of double_crochet plus one row of single_crochet down the centre- in worsted with a 5 mm hook hot tips if you re doing more than one row of the morse code make sure that you set yourself up row wise so they all fall on the right side i found *1
